thread.title_full: PCLA-Dubai continues to inspect companies for midday break law violations | MENAFN.COM

author: Emirates News Agency (WAM)
title: PCLA-Dubai continues to inspect companies for midday break law violations
text:
(MENAFN - Emirates News Agency (WAM)) The Permanent Committee of Labours' Affairs in Dubai (PCLA-Dubai) is conducting regular inspections in companies in Dubai to ensure they are implementing the midday break law.

The PCLA said that inspection patrols make daily visits to companies located across the city to ensure that no labourers are found on site between 12:30 pm and 3:00 pm and reports findings of any breaches to the committee.

Major General Obaid Muhair Bin Surour, Deputy Director of the General Directorate of Residency and Foreigners Affairs-Dubai, and Chairman of the PCLA, said, "Inspection teams use smart devices to report violations and document them by filming any workers found on duty during banned hours. The committee will then take necessary action against company owners who are found violating the law."

Major General Bin Surour said that records from almost 10,000 company visits found that 9,662 inspected firms were compliant. He added that the PCLA-Dubai patrols closely monitor areas in Bur Dubai and Deira.

He said that the inspections are part of the PCLA commitment towards protecting labours' rights and ensuring their safety and are provided with a healthy work place and environment, which includes their protection from the hazards of working under direct sunlight and dangerous high temperatures.

In early July, the PCLA launched an awareness campaign among employers and workers on the importance of abiding with the law which is also based on risk-prevention. It also urged companies to provide water and cold juices during resting periods.

"We have to take all kind of preventive measures to protect outdoor workers against the summer heat," Bin Surour said.

The decision, which was implemented in 2005, was launched to promote health and safety precautions for outdoor workers while on duty, in accordance to international standards. A fine of AED5,000 per worker will be imposed on companies violating the midday break rule.

Inspection patrols are conducted between 12pm-3pm daily, and will continue until September 15th.
